alert.note: Alert for Goshen; Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 28 at 1:41PM MST until January 28 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 215 PM MST. * At 140 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of Whitaker to 7 miles west of Warren AFB, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 30. Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 344 and 367. Locations impacted include... Cheyenne, South Greeley, Ranchettes, Warren AFB, Frontier Park, Whitaker, North Cheyenne, Warren Af Base, Fox Farm-College and South Greeley High. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
